teams.title: Organisation Development Consultant - Talent and Leadership
teams.name: Dr. Leila Otieno
teams.story: I have dedicated 16 years of my career to LifeGivers in Kenya. I began as a Trainee Medical Laboratory Scientific Officer (MLSO) and steadily advanced to the role of Biomedical Scientist. Over time, I assumed the position of MLSO 2 in Research and Development, followed by leadership roles as a Team Manager in Histocompatibility and Immunogenetics and later in Red Cell Immunohaematology. I was subsequently seconded into an Organization Development Manager role. My journey with LifeGivers commenced when a friend introduced me to the blood bank at our Aghakhan facility in Nairobi. After interviews with both LifeGivers and a hospital laboratory, I knew without a doubt that LifeGivers was the place for me due to the warm and supportive atmosphere I encountered.
teams.quote: 'I relish having the chance to engage with individuals and teams across the organisation to give them recognition and my personal thanks for what they are doing to save and improve lives.'

teams.title: Transport and Logistics Manager
teams.name: Sir. Eric Mong'are
teams.story: My journey with LifeGivers began in the payroll department, where I started as a house porter, responsible for distributing payslips across different regions. Over time, I transitioned to the Transport office, progressing from Trainee Computer Operator to eventually becoming the Transport and Logistics Manager. In this role, our team plays a pivotal role in the collection and transportation of vital donations and even the transportation of donors themselves.  What sets us apart is our unique responsibility for both equipment transportation and the donated resources during donor session setups, ultimately contributing to our mission of saving lives across Kenya.
teams.quote: 'I’ve been here 21 years and couldn’t imagine working anywhere else.'

teams.title: Research Manager
teams.name: Dr. Susan Mutiso
teams.story: I am part of a research team at LifeGivers, and we are leading the charge in pioneering revolutionary research. Our focus is on cultivating red blood cells within a laboratory setting for human transfusions, marking a historic moment in medical science. It's essential to clarify that our innovative approach is not a replacement for traditional blood donations. Instead, we target specific patient groups like those grappling with Sickle Cell Anemia. Our lab-grown cells closely match individual patient needs, reducing exposure risks to various blood group antigens. This breakthrough could potentially reduce the frequency of procedures, significantly improving patients' quality of life.
teams.quote: 'The aim of our research is to help a niche group of patients have a better quality of life. Not to replace donations.'

teams.title: Computer Operations Manager
teams.name: Prof Kelvin Kinyajui
teams.story: I play a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless operation of our systems. I am committed to providing donors with the best possible experience by maintaining and optimizing our computer systems. My mission is to ensure that everyone within our organization is well-versed in utilizing these systems effectively. By doing so, we empower our team to continue their life-saving work with efficiency and precision, ultimately making a meaningful impact on the lives we touch.
teams.quote: 'We all play a role in helping donors have the best experience, and we need to make sure everyone knows how to use our systems.'

teams.title: Donor Welfare Manager
teams.name: Dr. Rhona Joy
teams.story: I have been an integral part of the LifeGivers team, serving as the Donor Welfare Manager. With my dedication and compassion, I ensure that our donors have the best possible experience and support throughout their journey. My commitment to donor welfare goes beyond the immediate donation process, as I play a crucial role in providing care and assistance to our generous donors. My unwavering dedication to our mission has made a significant impact on the lives we touch.
teams.quote: 'I believe that donors are the lifeblood of our organization, and their welfare is of utmost importance. Together, we can continue to save lives and make a positive difference in our community.'

teams.title: Founder
teams.name: Dr. Orandi Felix
teams.story: In 2001, I founded LifeGivers, a Kenyan-based charity dedicated to addressing blood shortages within the African and Kenyan communities. The inception of our mission began with Blood for Life, aimed at raising awareness and engaging communities in blood donation. With invaluable support from the National Health Service Blood and Transplant (NHSBT), we've expanded our services to include tissues, cord blood, organs, bone marrow, and platelets. Our commitment to saving lives and ensuring a steady supply of life-saving resources remains unwavering.
teams.quote: 'The gift of life is the most precious one can give. Join us in making a difference and giving hope to those in need.'

sections.title: Who We Are
sections.description: At LifeGivers, we are a dedicated team of individuals committed to saving lives through various life-giving services. Learn more about our mission and values.

sections.title: What you Can Donate
sections.description: Discover who is eligible to become a donor and how you can contribute to our life-saving efforts. Find out if you meet the requirements to make a difference.

sections.title: Where to Donate
sections.description: Explore our donation centers and facilities, located in different regions. Find a convenient location near you to make your contribution.

sections.title: When You Can Donate
sections.description: Learn about our donation schedules and the best times to make your donation. Find out how you can fit blood, organ, and other donations into your busy life.

sections.title: Stories About Our Donations
sections.description: Read heartwarming stories from donors, recipients, and our team. Discover the impact of your donations and the lives you've touched.

sections.title: Donating During Coronavirus
sections.description: Get information on how we have adapted our donation processes to ensure safety during the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn about the precautions we take to protect donors and recipients.

faqs.question: What is LifeGivers?
faqs.answer: LifeGivers is a dedicated organization committed to saving lives through various life-giving services. Our mission is to provide a vital lifeline through blood donation, organ transplantation, tissue preservation, cord blood banking, bone marrow transplants, platelet therapies, and more.

faqs.question: How can I become a donor?
faqs.answer: To become a donor, you can check our eligibility requirements on our website. If you meet the criteria, you can sign up and choose the donation type you'd like to participate in.

faqs.question: Where can I donate?
faqs.answer: We have donation centers and facilities located in different regions. You can find a convenient location near you on our website.

faqs.question: When can I donate?
faqs.answer: We have donation schedules that you can check on our website. We offer flexible timings to accommodate your busy life.

faqs.question: What impact do my donations have?
faqs.answer: Your donations have a significant impact on saving lives. They provide essential resources like blood, organs, tissues, and more to those in need. You make a world of difference.

faqs.question: How can I donate during the COVID-19 pandemic?
faqs.answer: We have adapted our donation processes to ensure safety during the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn about the precautions we take to protect donors and recipients on our website.

faqs.question: Can I donate if I have a medical condition?
faqs.answer: It depends on the medical condition. Some conditions may disqualify you from certain types of donation, while others may not. Check our eligibility criteria and consult with our medical team for specific guidance.
